snippet: Tea Party-backed Republican candidates for the Senate are looking to infuse the upper chamber with the deep-seated conservatism that is present in the House.
abstract: Primary victory of Tea-Party-backed candidate Richard E Mourdock in the Indiana Senate race illustrates the group's influence in determining whether Republicans will be able to retake a Senate majority; Tea-Party candidates have pledged to infuse the upper chamber with the same deep-seated conservatism that has been the hallmark of the House since 2010.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Tea Party-backed Republican candidates for the Senate are looking to infuse the upper chamber with the deep-seated conservatism that is present in the House.

headline.main: For Tea Party, Focus Turns to Senate and Shake-Up
headline.print_headline: Tea Party Focus Turns to Senate And Shake-Up
